name: hc_wastewater_h2s_fz
description: [HC] H2S wastewater + GDB FZ ‚Üí BLOCK (zinc attacked), suggest SF
query: Wastewater plant exhaust. Hydrogen Sulfide (H2S) present. We want GDB in FZ.

turns.content: Wastewater plant exhaust. Hydrogen Sulfide (H2S) present. We want GDB in FZ.

The GDB filter housing in FZ (C3 galvanized steel) is not suitable for the wastewater plant exhaust application due to the presence of H2S (Hydrogen Sulfide) which causes aggressive corrosion of zinc coatings. The housing itself has corrosion class C2.Additionally, the GDB filter housing is not rated for ENV_WASTEWATER installation. The SINGLE_WALL_UNINSULATED construction does not meet the leakage class and hygiene requirements for this environment.Therefore, this configuration is BLOCKED. No standard catalog product currently satisfies all requirements simultaneously.A suitable solution would need to be constructed from a material with a higher corrosion resistance (minimum C5 such as RF or SF) and be rated for ENV_WASTEWATER installation, with a construction that meets the leakage class and hygiene requirements for this environment.I recommend contacting our Custom Engineering or Technical Support team with these specific technical requirements.

gemini.explanation: The system correctly identifies a critical material incompatibility. It accurately cites the standard corrosion class of the GDB housing from the PDF and applies sound engineering judgment to block the use of galvanized steel in an environment with Hydrogen Sulfide (H2S), which is highly corrosive to zinc. The recommendation to seek a custom solution in stainless steel (RF/SF) is the correct professional advice.

dimension_explanations.correctness: Correctly identifies GDB as standard C2/FZ (PDF p.8) and correctly states that H2S requires C5/Stainless steel.
dimension_explanations.completeness: Fully addresses the user's request, explains the rejection, and provides the correct alternative path (custom engineering for RF/SF).
dimension_explanations.safety: Prevents a rapid corrosion failure and potential gas leakage in a hazardous environment.
dimension_explanations.tone: Professional and authoritative regarding the safety/engineering constraint.
dimension_explanations.reasoning_quality: Excellent link between the chemical hazard (H2S), the material properties (Zinc/FZ), and the resulting corrosion class requirement.
dimension_explanations.constraint_adherence: Strictly adheres to engineering safety rules regarding corrosion resistance, overriding the user's request for a standard product.

strengths: Accurate corrosion engineering logic (H2S vs. Galvanized)
Correct extraction of GDB standard specifications (C2 rating)
Safe and responsible blocking of an unsuitable configuration
pdf_citations: GDB tillverkas vanligen i f√∂rzinkat. Korrosivitets klass C2 (PDF p.8)
Material options: FZ, ZM, RF (PDF p.3)

openai.explanation: The system correctly flags that FZ/galvanized is a poor choice in H2S-laden wastewater exhaust and recommends higher-corrosion-resistance materials, which is sound. However, it makes several unsupported/incorrect catalog and engineering claims (e.g., stating GDB is single-wall uninsulated and that no standard product can meet requirements) and introduces non-catalog constraints (ENV_WASTEWATER, hygiene/leakage) without tying them to the stated application or the catalog‚Äôs EN test claims.

dimension_explanations.correctness: PDF confirms GDB is an indoor duct filter housing typically supplied in FZ with lengths 550/600 or 750/800 mm (GDB section), but the response incorrectly calls it ‚ÄúSINGLE_WALL_UNINSULATED‚Äù and claims the housing has corrosion class C2; engineering-wise, warning against galvanized in H2S service is sound.
dimension_explanations.completeness: It blocks the request but does not propose a concrete standard alternative from the shown range (e.g., ZM/RF/SF material execution of the same housing) nor ask for key details (location indoor/outdoor, washdown, target lifetime/corrosion class, dimensions/flow).
dimension_explanations.safety: Appropriately highlights aggressive corrosion risk of zinc in H2S wastewater exhaust and steers toward C5-class materials, reducing risk of premature failure/leaks.
dimension_explanations.tone: Professional and direct, appropriate for technical sales/engineering support.
dimension_explanations.reasoning_quality: Reasoning is partially logical (H2S ‚Üí corrosion ‚Üí higher class material) but then jumps to leakage/hygiene noncompliance and ‚Äúno standard product‚Äù without evidence or intermediate justification.
dimension_explanations.constraint_adherence: Violates catalog constraints by asserting construction and corrosion-class details that conflict with the PDF (e.g., GDB door is insulated; EN 15727/EN 1886 testing is stated), and over-blocks by claiming no standard product can satisfy requirements despite catalog material options.

strengths: Correctly identifies H2S wastewater exhaust as a high-corrosion environment where galvanized/FZ is a poor material choice.
Provides a safer direction (C5 materials like stainless/acid-proof) and recommends escalation to engineering support.
weaknesses: Incorrect/unsupported statements about GDB construction (single-wall uninsulated) and corrosion class, and it ignores that the catalog states EN 15727/EN 1886 testing for GDB.
Overly absolute conclusion (‚Äúno standard catalog product satisfies‚Äù) without checking/asking for material execution options (ZM/RF/SF) and without gathering basic design inputs.
pdf_citations: GDB: intended for indoor use; standard lengths 550/600 mm and 750/800 mm; PG 20 mm or optional 40 mm flange; tested per EN 15727:2010 and EN 1886:2007; service door is double-skin and heat/condensation insulated as standard (GDB description page).
Material table: FZ (Z275) corrosion class C3; RF (EN 1.4301) corrosion class C5; SF (EN 1.4404) corrosion class C5.1; ZM310 corrosion class C5 (Material page).

content_segments.text: The GDB filter housing in FZ (C3 galvanized steel) is not suitable for the wastewater plant exhaust application due to the presence of H2S (Hydrogen Sulfide) which causes aggressive corrosion of zinc coatings. The housing itself has corrosion class C2.

Additionally, the GDB filter housing is not rated for ENV_WASTEWATER installation. The SINGLE_WALL_UNINSULATED construction does not meet the leakage class and hygiene requirements for this environment.
Therefore, this configuration is BLOCKED. No standard catalog product currently satisfies all requirements simultaneously.

A suitable solution would need to be constructed from a material with a higher corrosion resistance (minimum C5 such as RF or SF) and be rated for ENV_WASTEWATER installation, with a construction that meets the leakage class and hygiene requirements for this environment.
I recommend contacting our Custom Engineering or Technical Support team with these specific technical requirements.
